title: The game behind oriented percolation
abstract:
We characterize the critical parameter of oriented percolation on
$\mathbb{Z}^2$ through the value of a zero-sum game. Specifically, we define a
zero-sum game on a percolation configuration of $\mathbb{Z}^2$, where two
players move a token along the non-oriented edges of $\mathbb{Z}^2$, collecting
a cost of 1 for each edge that is open, and 0 otherwise. The total cost is
given by the limit superior of the average cost. We demonstrate that the value
of this game is deterministic and equals 1 if and only if the percolation
parameter exceeds $p_c$, the critical exponent of oriented percolation.
Additionally, we establish that the value of the game is continuous at $p_c$.
Finally, we show that for $p$ close to 0, the value of the game is equal to 0.
